Betreff: Re: AW: [junit] get Message "Co=

Wolfgang,

Firs=
t, I saw no code.  If you attached it as a file, it is probably being strip=
ped.  You have two choices here, inline the code with the message or put it=
 in the 'Files' section of this group and let us know where it is.

Now on =
to the point of the message:

Curious.  This is totally different behavior,=
 as you can see.  Here the suite was invoked.  I see nothing in the trace t=
o lead me to a conclusion though.  However, about your classpath -- look in=
 your <jdk-install-directory>/lib/ext.  Is there a crimson.jar, xerces.jar,=
 or xercesImpl.jar?  If so, you will need to purge them.  The JDK 1.3 autom=
atically takes anything in the lib/ext directory and prepends it to your cl=
asspath.

Also, I assume you are using SUN's JDK.  Is that so?

One other n=
ote, if you compile with debugging information you will get the line number=
 in the stack trace.

=3Djason

On Wed, 2003-03-05 at 14:09, Weber, Wolfgan=
g wrote: Hi Jason (and all the others)! 

I followed your suggestion to use=

FAILURES!!!
=
Tests run: 1,  Failures: 1,  Errors: 0

This means that the classpath is ri=
ght. What's wrong so far is the number of runs, Junit reported: 1. 

Using =
the code inside VAJ, there are 3 runs and that what the line "Es wurden 3 T=
estfaelle eingelesen!" means: 3 testcases. But Junit stopped after the firs=
t Assert.fail. 

Somebody asked for the code. Here we are. I hope you can f=
ind the problem. Thank you very much for your support.
